Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2008 07:15AM marilynh wrote: Well i had the biopsy this morning -- new machinery plus was a guinea pig for something new --- i climbed on this bed - i was shown all the machinery and what was going to happen etc and that i need to lie very still for a long time - this took about 1.5 hrs.I never felt a thing no pain at all - i couldnt see what they were doing which was good - i had taken no medication at all.They removed 2 microcalicification clusters and on the screen they were gone after they have taken the samples this was then flushed out where the micros were with saline and another name which is foreign to me and this is supposed to stop bleeding inside the breast which it did..They managed to get to the correct allocation of the micros.I was then finished had a cup of tea and went home - no pain at all no discomfort whatsoever and feel fine - now its just the waiting for the results which i have been told 48 hours and could be 24hrs as it was marked urgent - so hopefully by the weekend i will know so i either have to plan the next action or rejoice and celebrate so being positive this is what i will do -- champayne here i come

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2008 11:37AM - edited Oct 4, 2008 11:40AM by marilynh Hi here is a letter explaining the biospy that is going to be formed on me on the 16th October This is a new type of Biopsy device --- vacuum assisted biopsy (vacora)This type of biopsy performed depends on the abnormality found. It is often necessary to remove larger samples of tissue to obtain a definitive diapnosis so that open surgical biopsy is not necessary.They offer use of a new innovative biopsy needle which enables larger specimens to be removed.The advantages are It is a all in one unit, therefore samples are easier to obtain. The procedure is more accurate than conventional biopsies and equates to open surgical biopsy done under anaesthetic. It is less disfiguring and less invasive that open surgery. The patient lies on her stomach on a special table - discomfort is minimal.THe procedure lasts about 45 minutes.Local anaesthetic is given. Normal activities may be resumed straight away -- complications ---very rare if any - infection and bleeding. I am in South Africa so looks like we are quite advanced --- still doesnt stop me stressing - but at least i can lie down and not sit like i did for my first biopsy.
